content.description: Interesting climb on the Crime Buttress. Passes a few blank areas, a few no hands ledges and pumpy headwall that could spit off an unassuming suitor.  Keep it together up high, it's all there.
content.location: This shares the start and first 3 bolts with Liars, 12c, then breaks left at the obvious no hands at the 4th bolt.  One bolt-line left of Standing Room Only on the Crime Buttress.

content.description: Starts in a left-facing corner into a steep face to a ledge. Continue past over some bulges and take it to the finish!
Follow the obvious weakness, negotiating corners and bulges.
content.location: The rightmost route on the Crime Buttress.

content.description: Left of Halfway.  Serves as a decent warmup to the harder climbs at crime buttress.
Same start as Greed, a boulder problem past a roof. Trend right. Save some mojo for the second roof just below the anchors.
content.location: Shares the same start as Greed.

content.description: This route features a pretty cool dyno for most people, with some interesting endurance climbing on the upper overhang. All the climbing is on terrific rock, and the only thing really detracting from the quality is two standing rests that divide the route.
content.location: Second bolt line from the right on the crime buttress. Shares a start with Thieves, then moves right at the first large ledge. You could equally access this route from the start of Standing Room Only.

content.description: Head up the face until you reach some right facing flakes. Take the right line of bolts to some tricky moves to the anchors.

Mistakenly got on this thinking it was thieves. Guidebook gives this 11d I’d give it a solid NRG 12a. Close enough regardless and a great route Guidebook says to share the framed anchors. But there is another set of anchors in between “framed” and “if I had a shotgun”. Requiring 10 bolts plus anchors  instead of 8 so I’m confused.  Maybe I used The looters anchors when I climbed framed don’t know. It’s likely I’m a idiot and am using the correct anchors.   Start by using a leftward side pull requiring high feet and reach up and grab the jug to get off the ground and clip the first bolt.  paddle through jugs with a few crimps in between to a thought provoking section  to reach the  ledge below the roof. Pull the guns out and make a few large moves up and left to reach the next bolt. Moving right at this bolt would take you to street crime 11d’s anchors. It seems there is several ways to go here. Moving up and left or going straight up. If you go left you can go to framed anchors  or straight up pulling the final roof and tick tacking through slab to a bolt and anchors.  Which seems to not get a lot of traffic. This should change!If anyone has better info for this route if I am doing the correct route or if this is a different route due to a extension please let me know and I will change it
content.location: Between framed and thieves. Same start as street crimes

content.description: Start on Iron Buns and go left at the ledge to a final few bolts positioned between smaller holds.  This is a quality route but meanders some.

A short route that climbs better than it looks. Climb jugs and edges to a nice mantle about halfway up. Finish on easier terrain. A great warmup for crime buttress, sans a brief bush encounter just before the mantle.
content.location: Just up the hill from Iron Buns

content.description:
"Greed...is good" 

  Stick clip the first bolt shared with Looters then campus the crazy roof start. Boulder through the technical crux around the third bolt. 

  Crawl into a hole about midpoint and recover, then pump out the roof...the top is technical and somewhat cryptic, but not hard if you nail the sequences. 

  Clip the anchors, give a "Braaawwk" yell and lower.
content.location:
This is the second route left on the left side of the Crime Buttress. 

  Shares the first bolt with Looters (12b).

content.description: Stick Clip. Start on small holds, and make some bouldery moves up the overhanging arete. Continue up on vertical terrain and then catch a full rest inside a cave. Then climb out of the cave onto very steep climbing. Pull moves on good holds and fight the pump all the way to the anchors.
Basically a continuation of the So What section, starting 20' left of Reach.
